revised_title: Spermatozoal Cladistics and the Phylogenetic Position of the Tuatara
tldr: The authors conducted a cladistic analysis of 16 spermatozoal ultrastructure characters in the tuatara (Sphenodon) and other amniotes. The analysis confirmed the tuatara's primitive status and suggested that monotremes are the sister-group of birds, while squamates form the sister-group of a bird + monotreme assemblage. The study also indicated that the tuatara has a close relationship with turtles, making it the most primitive amniote except for chelonia.
